metadata.title: CVE-2014-8118 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in RPM 4.12 and earlier allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code via a crafted CPIO header in the payload section of an RPMfile, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

debugedit - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
librpm3 - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
librpmbuild3 - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
librpmio3 - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
librpmsign1 - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
python-rpm - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
rpm - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
rpm-common - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
rpm-i18n - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
rpm2cpio - 4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rpm package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-3ubuntu0.1').
